text: I have waited for months to have procedures to find out what is going on with my health. Dr Harry cancelled my procedure 3 times. Now I have to start over and see another Gastroenterologist. A half of a year later.

name: Stacey Rice
text: I love Dr Hari dont get me wrong but seriously he needs someone that can better schedule his patients!!  The past 2 visits the wait has been over an hour!!  My previous visit I had to reschedule due to he was about 3 hours behind!  Why make people wait that long, just call us and reschedule without us having to miss work!!  Now today my appointment was at 12 and I've been here over an hour and they still say it will be another 20 to 30 minutes

name: Diane Stiffler
text: I totally trust Dr. Hari.  He is thorough and informative.   He tells you direct and does not sugar coat the situation if there is a problem.  My family uses Dr. Hari exclusively.

name: Dana Cease
text: Love Dr. Hari, but he really needs to get someone to answer the phone.  Regardless of what time during the day you call, no one never answers the phone.  Can't leave a message because its never cleared out and and its full.. Hell other Dr. Offices can't even get in touch with them. Dr. Hari will say call my office and make a appointment,  but with noone answering the phone,  how can you. Even went out to his office and still don't get a call back or anything else.

name: Dana Cease
text: If I could give a rating lower than one, I would do so. I have dealt with a lot of doctor's in my lifetime,  but never in my life have I dealt with a doctor's office that never has anyone answer the phones,  return phone calls or call and give the patient the results of test that he/ she may have had. I am not the only one that has the issue of getting someone to answer the phone or return your call as Heather claims they will do when you leave a message , and even then leaving a message you are lucky if they have it where you can. 99.9% of the time, the voice mail box is slam full and you can't leave a message.  Heather claims that calls will be returned but that is a flat out lie. Btw I am not the only patient with this issue. I have spoken with about 20 if not more patients who have the same issue. Same goes with other Dr. Offices, they can't even get anyone to call them back, nor are they able to even make a appointment with Dr. Hari's office cause there again no one ever answers the phone .. Pharmacy's are the same way, they are unable to get anyone to call them back when they call to get refills for a patients meds that they have no refills on. This is very unacceptable and as a doctor's office , his patients is not his first priority, or should I say it isn't his office people's priority.  I really did like Dr Hari but to be treated as I have been by his so called office staff is unacceptable.  He really needs to get someone in there that can do their job.  I am still waiting on test results from a ultrasound I had done of my stomach and liver , trying to figure out of I have cancer. I have several factors that could cause it. My mother died from it Jan 3, 2016. I did find out today through no help of his office that I could come to the hospital and go to medical records and get the info I need there.  I have two of my other doctor's who have been trying to get the results from him, and you guessed it, Heather nor anyone else will answer the phone and I am assuming she throws all medical requests from other docore in the trash. One of my doctors has faxed my medical release form 4 times and still nothing.  But gave up on calling.  Bottom line, this is NOT HOW YOU RUN A DOCTOR'S OFFICE AND IT'S VERY UNACCEPTABLE.

name: Brian T. Swords
text:
8/9/21
Handicap parking is downhill & in the rear of the building. It's then appx 150 yards back uphill & to the front entrance.

Went in for a consultation, after failing a Cologuard test but not with the doc. Staff only (pleasant). Was told I would meet him "just before the procedure". I really would have preferred to meet during the consult.

2.5 stars rounded up to 3. Will update, if needed, after the proc, several months from now. If guarding against colon cancer is important, then it shouldn't take 6 months or more to get checked. This is not a negative comment against the doc. Just a matter of frustration with the system.

text:
Felt rushed. We had to check in at 3 different desk (could have been because of Covid-19). We had to wait nearly 10 mins for the girl at the 3rd desk to return, so we could get our paperwork to fill out as new patients. The nurse that called us to the back wasn't very friendly. She was too chatty with other staff members. The nurse that came in for vitals came in pretty quickly. The doc came in shortly after that. I tried to turn the paperwork in to him. He said give it to the nurse. I tried to give it to the nurse. She said give it to check out. Tried to give it to check out, they said give it to the desk that had given it to us.
Again we waited so long for the girl at that 3rd desk to return that we nearly walked out of the place with the paperwork.
Last but not least the womans restroom wasn't very clean. Not like too scared to sit but more like paper products and water on the floor.
Gave 2 stars because of the waiting. They said should take 2 days for the test results. Which of course fell on a Friday. By 2pm on Monday still no call. It's not right to make a sick and disabled patient wait like that. Especially when they had the results on Friday (I asked).

text: Dr. Bradley Rice is a great physician! He answers all your questions in depth, and he does not mind taking a little extra time to make sure all your questions are answered. Overall, I had an amazing experience at Alabama Colon and Gastro and would recommend Dr. Rice to anyone.

name: Miranda Hadden
text: If I were able to give Dr. Rice a review simply for himself, he would be 5 stars.  He is willing to think outside of the box and takes other factors and conditions into account when trying to find a solution for your problem.  Unfortunately, my experience with his PA,  CRNP, and nurse were less than 1 star and those are the ones you typically have to see before you can see Dr. Rice.  They only want to hand you a prescription and schedule a follow up without really listening to what is going on.   On two occasions I specifically requested that my appointment be with Dr. Rice ONLY and still had to see the new CRNP.  This is when things went to a new level of unprofessional.  He wasn't even at the office on the day of my last appointment, which was surgical follow-up.  In my opinion, that is not OK.   I asked if there were a way for me to leave a message only for Dr. Rice about what had taken place, and was told that I couldn't.  There should be a way for patients to leave a message or contact the doctor directly so that they can hear first hand the patient experience when there is a problem with a member of his staff.

name: Michael Alexander
text: Let me make this very clear, i never write reviews but today my first one will go to Dr.Kashyap. I am a 25 year old male who went in to this office to get help with my problems. And after agreeing to operation not surgery related. I was put on a good bit of medication, barley knowing what's wrong with me. Let me tell you after that operation. i haven't seen Dr.Kashyap since, even though i used up a lot of my insurance to get me help. The man makes a trip to California, doesn't even tell me knowing this a current thing that i just got. I call the office and the nurses (Great people) try to help me and get him on the phone. Next it turns out i have a gallbladder check up that i didn't even know about. And i had to find that out the hard way by calling the office to get help because my medicine was rejecting my body. Then not only could the nurse not get ahold of him the man never called me or spoke to me about whats wrong with me. I know how doctor life works. And i am not on here to exploit or ruin anyone. But those who have concern for your health dont go to him. He doesnt really talk to you about anything, hell send you to do test and you wont hear one word from him. Im a patient of his and ive only seen him once. I found out by my fiance and a piece of paper of what is wrong with me. And if hes reading this let him. Because he needs to know some people pay good money for a good doctor and he is not one of them.

text: Edit - The staff is incredibly hateful and rude other than the ladies in the lab and the nurses (whenever you can get up with them . ) I had labs done 3 weeks ago and I know it takes time to get those back , I get that . But I called today and explained I needed a print out of at least what labs were back to take with me to my endocrinologist at UAB tomorrow - and I know some are back because I got the notification they were back on my MyChart portal I just can’t see the results .  I was talked to like dirt by whoever I was transferred to and told ‘ I’m not releasing those to you until we send you a letter, and I don’t know what print out you’re talking about’ So basically I’ve called and asked for calls back with NO REPLY multiple times ; and they won’t just let me go get a letter from them in person that I really need by tomorrow for my endo that I’ve asked for for 3 weeks ?? Then I sit on the phone for 30 minutes literally each time only to get no answers. I’m most likely going to transfer my business to the gastro doctors in Montgomery , although legally , this place still has to give me my lab results upon request .I have been having sharp stomach pain for the last month and even called and told them I was still having this pain last Friday even on the med they prescribed . Once again , zero response . They truly don’t care about their patients apparently

name: Stephanie Lane
text: I have had stomach complications for over 8 years now. I have been to multiple doctor offices that deal with stomach issues over the years. I've always been told that I'm too young to have problems and I've been overlooked or mistreated by MD's or PA's. I was even told one time in a nice/nasty way that I was making problems up in my head and that nothing was wrong. After I threw a fit because I was in so much pain, she (the PA) decided to do one last test and it concluded that I had SIBO(small intestinal bacteria overgrowth). I was sick with this for 2 years before any doctor even tried doing this test on me. Unfortunately, the only way to find this out is by a breath test. It doesn't show up in blood work, urine, or any other exams or scans. I have since then had other issues and now i am trying this facility out. So far, this place is the best one yet! You dont have a long wait time, the staff are amazing, they get you in and out, they really seem to care about people, and my doctor (Dr. Nelson) is the best! I recommend this place to anyone! Thank You All so much for the amazing work you do. I haven't been coming here long but I'm so glad that I decided to give this place a try!

resp.text: Ms. Lane, Thank you so much for your sweet review! We also think Dr. Nelson is one of the best. We will share you sweet words with him and his team.

name: Google User
text: I worked for them through a temp company and did my job. It was very simple work. There was much talk about hiring me on to their company from my supervisor from the time I started working. That completely stopped when I told them I was pregnant. I only worked for two or three weeks after that before they contacted my temp agency and stated that the position "just wasn't working out." I could actually schedule all of my OB appointments on Friday afternoons, because we only worked half a day that day. Therefore, my appointments would never be an issue and interfere with work. I had a feeling that my supervisor  would have an issue with my pregnancy. When I told her, she seemed slightly appalled. Usually, a person would have been happy for the person expecting and congratulated her. My supervisor stood clear of me for the next two or three weeks and had my temp agency call to let me go after work one day. My temp agency was quite confused, considering they(my temp agency) awarded me Employee of the Month this time last year and I've always received great reviews from each any every one of employers through my temp agency.

name: Hiram Taylor
text: This clinic and Dr. Tarwater literally saved my wife's life. When I was 31 and living in New Orleans I lost a wife to colon cancer. One of the factors was that the doctors treating her blew off her symptoms, because of her age,  until it was too late. With similar symptoms my current wife Libi visited Dr. Tarwater at Digestive Health. Dr. Tarwater said that even though the probability was extremely small for someone her age (she was 44 at the time) he did not want to take any chances and scheduled her for a colonoscopy. Based on my previous experience, I was all for it, though I thought the chances were probably pretty slim as well that it would be anything serious. To our horror and disbelief. Dr. Tarwater found colon cancer. He was really great about how he broke the news to us, praying with us and giving us a lot of hope. Because of Dr. Tarwater's insistence on doing a through job, we caught it early and it was cured with surgery. She didn't even have to do chemo. I thank God everyday for Dr. Tarwater and the team at Digestive Health and especially God's mercy in guiding us to where we needed to be for her treatment. In another situation,  my mother-in-law had to go to the hospital because of intestinal distress that turned out to be a life-threatening condition. Cody, the nurse practitioner,  who was working at Flowers Hospital at the time, intervened in her care and immediately recognized the seriousness of her condition making sure her treatment was swift, which probably saved her life. So I feel like I owe the lives two people whom I care about very much to the expertise and care at Digestive Health. One other thing. IF YOU ARE 50 OR OVER GET YOUR COLONOSCOPY IT CAN SAVE YOUR LIFE! IF YOU HAVE RECTAL BLEEDING OR OTHER SYMPTOMS, INSIST ON SEEING THE SPECIALIST AT DIGESTIVE HEALTH. For us it made all the difference in the world.

resp.text: Thank you for such a wonderful review and such sweet words!

name: Evie Granberry
text: The Staff are all so nice and informative! I have always been taken in on time too.

resp.text: Thank you for such a wonderful review and such sweet words!

name: Christopher Senn
text: I arrived on time and was seen in short order. Had orders for a cat scan with contrast. First I warn the woman who does the iv contrast that my veins are hard and showed her where to start the iv. She ignores my advice, sticks me for 10 minutes. Finally, she moves me out and continues with the rest of her patients. Just because you don't want to deal with my problems, doesn't mean you can ignore my appointment.

name: John Mursch
text:
Appointment was scheduled for 1010. Got here 20 minutes early and filled out some paperwork as a first time patient. Waited 30 minutes to be called back, waited 20 more minutes for a nurse practitioner, still waiting a full 1 hour 10 minutes past my appointment time for a consult! I wouldn't voluntarily make an appointment here again and I will be complaining with my insurance provider.

Dr. Lamb was in and out in 5 minutes. The doctor was professional and courteous. Ordered  a follow-on procedure and now I am waiting again to schedule it. It's been 1 hour 25 minutes since my scheduled appointment time.

Upgrading to 5 stars. Although the wait time seems ridiculous to me I am used to being seen by military health care providers. I upgraded to 5 stars from 3 because the staff seems to really make an effort to accommodate individual patient circumstances.

name: Amanda Schreffler
text: I cannot express how thankful I am to of found this office. Dr. Lamb took the time and listened closely to everything I said, didn’t just blow me off. They looked into every possible thing they could in helping my diagnosis. The nurse, Judy,  is amazing! Any time I called, my phone call was returned within a couple hours and with answers/something new I could try. If I needed a prescription, it was sent almost immediately after the phone call. The wait time is so minimal and all staff are so sweet. I wish all my drs showed the care they do! When you are in pain and it’s affecting your life majorly, you need someone to want to find your answer and they do everything they can to do so.

text: New patient here.  The nurse that checked me in was EXTREMELY pleasant, very kind and thoughtful.  My CNA was cheerful, very calming... Dr Clark finally got around to seeing me after a very short wait and was the picture of professionalism.  He was genuinely interested in my case and didn't push anything and truly had my health and care in mind.  My only complaint is that it took the VA so bloody long to get me to be seen by such an amazing group of medical specialist!

text: My wife had some symptoms that are usually associated with minor digestive conditions, but Dr. Tarwater wanted to be through and make sure she was okay. The colonoscopy revealed colon cancer. I had already lost a wife to colon cancer when I was thirty-one because her doctors dismissed the exact same symptoms as trivial. If you come to Digestive Health expect to receive the best possible care with doctors who care about their patients and won't stop looking till they find out what is wrong.

name: Samuel Steele
text: I had the worst experience with Dr. Habermacher, I had went to ER with a kidney stone and was told it measured 7mm, was told to follow up with Urologist from your clinic,I saw NP on day of appointment which was very nice,I ask for a scan to be done before so we would know if stone was still there. The morning of surgery, Dr. Habermacher came into room I ask if he was going to do scan to make sure stone was gone, he replied no, it will be gone today one way or another. I had passed very small pieces of stone but definitely not a 7mm in prior week.When I awoke from procedure I was told there was no stone, after getting home I was very sick from procedure and very sore. I went for my follow-up, I told the girl that checked me in that I was upset that he did not do KUB to make sure the stone was gone also, that I am a nurse and have had enough of kidney stone patients to know how to check for kidney stones and I definitely had not passed a 7mm. She said I will tell him, she immediately came back in room and said this is a nurse visit, he wants you to do 24 hr urine and come back in 2 months. I have no intentions of ever using him again, why would you not do a KUB or scan to make sure it's gone before putting someone through this, it sounds like it's all about money to me. WILL NEVER use this Dr again.

text: At times finding proper care that gives you the feeling your best interest has been top priority can be a challenge in the Montgomery area.  We typically go to Birmingham for peace of mind. Dr. Habermacher understood my level of comprehension to quickly lend understanding to my concerns & how to handle my own personal health going forward.  Without being too long winded, I have to express gratitude for the opening and benefits of this clinic for Montgomery residents & anyone within reasonable distance.  Checks all the boxes both physically and psychologically to assure patients care is their top priority.

name: Jeff chappell
text:
Apparently negative reviews get taken down quickly?  Dr. Thudi, an endo, has the worst communication skills.  Does not listen, assumes, and is too proud to admit mistakes.  They return calls, but only if you're waiting by the phone.  No voicemails except "please call us back" and you never get a live person, so it's voicemail tag over and over and over.  Add that to their "never on Friday" rules and you've got a setup for making money with zero customer service, much less patient service.
And DON'T even think of adding a response to this about "We'd like to talk with you about your experience".  We spoke, we emailed, and THIS IS my response to your customer care.  Don't act like this is the first you have heard of the problem.

name: Jenny Clark
text: Oh boy!  I had a very awful experience with one of the female doctors at this practice.  Personally, if you are considering this place, I would just run like H3LL.  I had symptoms of acid reflux and had an ENT confirm what I thought it was.  I asked to get an endo done just to ensure my throat did not have Barrett's.  They referred me for the procedure and one of the female doctor's performed the endo.  Prior to this I had never met this doctor.  I explained my acid reflux and she said it could be my gallbladder since I had a child 1.5 years prior.  She recommended an ultrasound and hyda scan.  I went in for both and it was found that I did have a gallstone.  The hyda scan was normal.  The gastro doc immediately referred me to a surgeon to have my gallbladder removed.  I was blown away!  I had never had any typical gallbladder attacks or pain.  After doing more research I found out that having your gallbladder removed can actually cause bile reflux due to the constant free flow of bile into your system once the gallbladder is removed and the bile has no where else to go.  This doctor could not even read details of my ultra sound so I had to rely on some random doctor (over the phone) to tell me that yes, I have a rather large stone.  This female gastro doc never made any follow up appointment with me.  I immediately canceled the surgery.  I have since discussed this decision with other doctors (ENT and family doctor) and they agree with my decision.  My one gallstone while big is not currently causing typical symptoms.  There is absolutely no guarantee that removal of my gallbladder will fix the acid reflux.  And, recently, my acid reflux has been manageable with a proper clean (and green) diet. Folks, after doing much research, I am convinced that probably millions of Americans have gallstones.  Why?  Diet, it's that simple.  Our diet is just too high in fat, salt, and sugar amongst other things.  A lot of people have gallstones without even knowing UNLESS they have a gallbladder attack that lands them in the ER (or in my case was found just by chance).  In my opinion, gallbladder pain and recurrent attacks are reasons to remove the gallbladder.  Yes, you can live without your gallbladder but you can also live without your arm.  Your body functions better with both so unless you are having issues, think really hard about whether it's worth losing an organ.  In very rare cases, gallbladder disease in the form of stones can lead to major illnesses like cancer.  However, IF you drastically improve your diet, I do believe you can control your destiny.  Remember, everything begins in the gut!  Obviously, I am not a medical doctor, so these opinions are my own.  My last words of advice: get 2 or 3 opinions and remember that doctors are in the business to make money.

name: X 21
text: I had emergency surgery to remove my gallbladder (different Dr.) but 4 stones were lodged in the duct that goes from it to the stomach and he could not remove them.  So the next morning Dr. Eloubeidi did an upper GI to remove them from the stomach side.  Afterwards, he told me it should've taken 15min to get them, but with great difficulty, he worked for over an hour and finally was able to remove them.  If he had not been able to, I was facing a long, painful recovery from a 6" incision to remove them!  I think many doctors would have given up and not took the time.. he would've gotten paid for the procedure anyway, right?  But he went above and beyond to get the job done, and I am so thankful to him for that!!  To all you whiners who didn't get your appointment on time and had to wait a little longer, just remember, YOU may be facing a bad situation one day.. THEN you'll be glad you had a Dr. like Eloubeidi who cares enough to go the extra mile for you!  Thank You Dr. E!!!!

text:
well a little hard to review.
i wrote a negative review. but then the Dr called me about my dissatisfaction and listened to my complaint and I am ok with that. So turned my negative review to a positive review.
I was always happy with the medical treatment...zero complaint there.

I would say this... they should do a better job of setting expectation... as in...they should say

"you have an appointment to follow up with the physician's assistant. if you would like to talk to the physician, that is a different scheduling."

and it would be super nice if they would say

"we are running behind today your appointment is at 10...but...  if you have something else you would like to go do for a couple hours and come back, that would be great."

if they had done one of those things i wouldn't have been as angry in the first place. If they had done both of them i would have been quite happy.

I changed my rating from a ticked off 3 to a happy 5 because Dr. Eloubeidi called and listened to my whining himself.  :)

name: Russell Marks
text: I was schedule for a colonoscopy on Mar 4th.  I was notified that I had to report to Surgery Center for Covid 19 test prior to having the procedure.  I called the doctor's office to see if I could have it done in Prattville area as I lived North of Prattville and was told to call Jackson Surgery Center, I did and they said that would be fine.  So I got the test and a letter saying  I had a negative result.  Then next day I get a call from JSC saying what I had was not good enough.  I was asked why I didn't get tested at JSC and explained that it was more convient to have it locally.  She stated that she lived south of Montgomery and came to work every day.  This really upset me!  Long story short I had already spent a whole afternoon getting tested and by the time she called had already begun the prep and had to cancel the procedure.  They need to get better people friendly personal    to contact patients and get there act together as far as what is acceptable covid testing.  I had this procedure at the JSC (prior to Covid) and it was a great experience just glad I didn't have contact with this person back then.

resp.text:
Mr. Marks, thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We apologize for any confusion.  We will address this issue with our staff, the response you received certainly isn't our expectation. For future reference we have Important Covid Information on our website. You can find it here to review our policies.

https://www.jscal.com/blog/covid-19-information/
If you have further issues or questions please contact our director Missy Sallas 334-293-8484

name: Jason York
text:
We were surprised by having to pay a second co-pay, one for the facility for the doctor. It was explained that this is because the doctor is not affiliated and it is an out patient surgery. However, the doctor's name is listed as part owner, not to mention the fact that we have had out patient surgeries in the past and not had separate co-pays. We will not be using this facility again, as it appears to be using any way possible to take money. We could have refused, but we already had the time scheduled off work, and it's hard to rearrange a surgery. At the very least, they could have let us know this in advance, instead of at the time of the surgery. We will be using the Baptist hospital system from now on.

Update: No, it wasn't really addressed, we were just told that we would have to pay again or reschedule. It's not about the money, it's about letting us know in advance that there are two separate co-pays, which was not done.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we apologize for any miscommunication. Our administrative team is aware of the concern and has addressed this with the patient.  If you need future assistance or have further questions about our billing policies, please contact our Administrator Mr. John Gray 334-293-8484

name: Barbara Sowell
text: Great experience! Wonderful staff. Highly recommend!

name: leo zemke
text: I am glad everyone else had such a fantastic experience at this place but they almost let my step son DIE!  He came in and was scheduled for exploratory surgery to fix SHODDY WORK DONE BY DR CHANDLER during a sinus polyp surgery and my step son began to pour blood from his Sphenopalatine Artery and the office was more worried about getting another three hundred dollar copay out of us than helping my son.  My wife had to scream for help in the office to get nurses and a doctor to get my son and help him.  We were treated shabbily during the whole ordeal.  My step son was bleeding to death and they did not even have the ability to  give him blood at this facility.  They almost killed him!  IT WAS HORRIBLE!  A HORRIBLE ORDEAL!!!!  I should post photos of all the blood.  The clinic manager was not friendly, everyone acted as if they did not know what was going on or what to do.  They had to take my son by ambulance over the the hospital and then the nightmare continued.  The ER doctor threw my son out of the hospital room that he was scheduled to be in.  It was like they tried to kill my son and then they were trying to sweep us under the carpet or out the door.  TO HIDE US AND THE HORRIBLE THINGS THEY DID AND THE WAY THEY ALMOST KILLED MY SON!!!   It was a nightmare!  They were going to give my son a blood transfusion in the ER and sweep us out the door.  MY WIFE HAD TO ENLIST THE HELP OF THE AMBULANCE DRIVERS Who could see that our son was in agony and practically DEAD AT THEIR HANDS!  The ambulance drivers GOD BLESS THEM talked the angry, crazy doctor into keeping our son and putting us in a room for the night.  This was the worst thing that has ever happened to our family.  I would not allow this clinic to operate on a PET COCKROACH if I had one!  PLEASE BEWARE!!!

resp.text: Dear Leo, we sincerely apologize for your experience with the Jackson Surgery Center.  We strive to provide the highest level of care equally to all of our patients.  We appreciate your feedback and are addressing the issues mentioned with our administrative team.  We promise to also forward your concerns to the Jackson Hospital Administration.  Our commitment to protecting patient privacy disallows us to discuss this in an open forum.  Please do not hesitate to contact our administrator John Gray at 334-293-8484

name: Whitney Boutwell

text: Everything! Everyone is effective, efficient, timely, knowledgeable, and friendly. I love this practice.

text:
Danielle and Dr. Gresham "listen" to me and
they throughly checked my illness ...
they have given me back my hope for a healthy life

resp.text: Hi Bonnie Marie, thank you so much for your positive comments about Dr. Gresham and Danielle.  Please don't hesitate to contact us if we can do anything else for you. Have a wonderful day!

name: Ken Chaney
text: Taking care of patients promptly and seeing to it that all needs are addressed.

resp.text: Your wonderful feedback and rating mean a lot to us.  Thanks for taking the time to leave a review.  Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

name: Cassandra Moore
text: Dr Shaffer nurse Ashley calls you back quick when you hav a problem which is what I really like

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. We hope you have a great day!

name: Jennifer Mills
text: I have had my appointment changed without acknowledgement of it. I got there way before my appointment & was told they have been trying to reach me to cancel my time.  BS.

name: Austin Barton
text: Awful quite a few of the staff were disrespectful laughed at me for not going with a more expensive procedure took a week to get results of a ultra sound I was told would only take 24hrs then I find out I was diagnosed with something four months later from a different care facility that request notes from here also took weeks to call in prescriptions

name: Thelma Kennedy
text: the service within itself

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to give us 5 stars!  Have a great day!

name: Martha Smith
text: Very sweet place Dr mcvay she is a caring doctor she is sweet and she is the best

name: Teresa Dailey
text: While the Dr is knowledgeable, she is terrible with reporting back on blood work she had me do. I have a call in and they will call me back😡 It has been 2 weeks and I have heard nothing. I am not happy. I found out I had polyps that we're precancerous and never received a call, just a letter in the mail, telling me about it. I am not convinced they have the patients best interest in mind!!! They only want my money!!!

name: Taylor Oliver
text: These docs are wonderful. They take time and listen. Staff is great and wait times short.

text: I use Dr Alison Bridges . She is very good and helpful . I will recommend to people that I know.
